pageProps.body:
Products

Dot Product

Definition

Given 2 nonzero vectors U⃗\vec{U}U and V⃗\vec{V}V in 2D or 3D, their dot product is U⃗⋅V⃗=∣U⃗∣∣V⃗∣cos⁡θ\vec{U}\cdot\vec{V}= |\vec{U}||\vec{V}|\cos{\theta}U⋅V=∣U∣∣V∣cosθ where θ\thetaθ is the angle between U⃗\vec{U}U and V⃗\vec{V}V with 0≤θ≤π0\leq\theta\leq\pi0≤θ≤π

Equation

U⃗=⟨U1,U2,U3⟩\vec{U}=\langle U_1,U_2,U_3\rangleU=⟨U1​,U2​,U3​⟩

V⃗=⟨V1,V2,V3⟩\vec{V}=\langle V_1,V_2,V_3\rangleV=⟨V1​,V2​,V3​⟩

U⋅V=U1V1+U2V2+U3V3=∣U⃗∣∣V⃗∣cos⁡θU \cdot V = U_1V_1+U_2V_2+U_3V_3=|\vec{U}||\vec{V}|\cos{\theta}U⋅V=U1​V1​+U2​V2​+U3​V3​=∣U∣∣V∣cosθ

Key Notes

  • Dot product is commutative

Orthogonal Vectors

Two vectors are orthogonal if U⃗⋅V⃗=0\vec{U}\cdot\vec{V}=0U⋅V=0. In 2D and 3D spaces, orthogonal means perpendicular (π2\frac{\pi}{2}2π​ angle between them)

Key Notes

  • There are an infinite number of orthogonal vectors to any one vector when length is not specified

Projections

The orthogonal projection is a vector that goes along U⃗\vec{U}U with length ∣V⃗∣cos⁡θ|\vec{V}|\cos{\theta}∣V∣cosθ

Equation

projU⃗V⃗=U⃗∣U⃗∣∣V⃗∣cos⁡θproj_{\vec{U}}\vec{V}= \frac{\vec{U}}{|\vec{U}|}|\vec{V}|\cos{\theta}projU​V=∣U∣U​∣V∣cosθ

Cross Product

Definition

Given two nonzero vectors uuu and vvv in I ⁣R3{\rm I\!R}^3IR3, the cross product is defined as u⃗×v⃗=∣u⃗∣∣u⃗∣sin⁡θn⃗\vec{u} \times \vec{v} = |\vec{u}||\vec{u}|\sin{\theta}\vec{n}u×v=∣u∣∣u∣sinθn where 0≤θ≤π0\leq\theta\leq\pi0≤θ≤π is the angle between u⃗\vec{u}u and v⃗\vec{v}v and n⃗\vec{n}n is the unit vector which is normal (perpendicular) to u⃗\vec{u}u and v⃗\vec{v}v whose direction is determined by the right hand rule

Equation u⃗×v⃗=∣u⃗∣∣u⃗∣sin⁡θn⃗\vec{u} \times \vec{v} = |\vec{u}||\vec{u}|\sin{\theta}\vec{n}u×v=∣u∣∣u∣sinθn

Key Notes

  • u⃗\vec{u}u and v⃗\vec{v}v are parallel if and only if u⃗×v⃗=0\vec{u}\times\vec{v}=0u×v=0
  • If u⃗\vec{u}u and v⃗\vec{v}v are two sides of a parallelogram, then the area of the paralllelogram is ∣u⃗×v⃗∣=∣u⃗∣∣v⃗∣sin⁡θ|\vec{u}\times\vec{v}| = |\vec{u}||\vec{v}|\sin{\theta}∣u×v∣=∣u∣∣v∣sinθ
  • v⃗×u⃗=−(u⃗×v⃗)\vec{v}\times\vec{u}=-(\vec{u}\times\vec{v})v×u=−(u×v)
  • u⃗×v⃗\vec{u}\times\vec{v}u×v is orthogonal to u⃗\vec{u}u and v⃗\vec{v}v which means that (u⃗×v⃗)⋅u⃗=0(\vec{u}\times\vec{v})\cdot\vec{u} = 0(u×v)⋅u=0 and (u⃗×v⃗)⋅v⃗=0(\vec{u}\times\vec{v})\cdot\vec{v} = 0(u×v)⋅v=0

Cross Product Distribution

With respect to addition

  • u⃗×(v⃗+w⃗)=u⃗×v⃗+u⃗×w⃗\vec{u}\times(\vec{v}+\vec{w}) = \vec{u}\times\vec{v} + \vec{u}\times\vec{w}u×(v+w)=u×v+u×w

  • (u⃗+v⃗)×w⃗=u⃗×w⃗+v⃗×w⃗(\vec{u}+\vec{v})\times\vec{w} = \vec{u}\times\vec{w} + \vec{v}\times\vec{w}(u+v)×w=u×w+v×w

If c is a scalar

-(cu⃗×v⃗=c(u⃗×v⃗)=u×(cv⃗)(c\vec{u}\times\vec{v}=c(\vec{u}\times\vec{v})=u\times(c\vec{v})(cu×v=c(u×v)=u×(cv)

Cross Products of Unit Vectors

flowchart LR i --> j --> k k --> i
  • iˆ×jˆ=kˆ\^{i}\times\^{j}=\^{k}iˆ×jˆ​=kˆ
  • jˆ×kˆ=iˆ\^{j}\times\^{k}=\^{i}jˆ​×kˆ=iˆ
  • kˆ×iˆ=jˆ\^{k}\times\^{i}=\^{j}kˆ×iˆ=jˆ​
  • jˆ×iˆ=−kˆ\^{j}\times\^{i}=-\^{k}jˆ​×iˆ=−kˆ
  • kˆ×jˆ=−iˆ\^{k}\times\^{j}=-\^{i}kˆ×jˆ​=−iˆ
  • iˆ×kˆ=−jˆ\^{i}\times\^{k}=-\^{j}iˆ×kˆ=−jˆ​
  • iˆ×iˆ=0\^{i}\times\^{i}=0iˆ×iˆ=0
  • jˆ×jˆ=0\^{j}\times\^{j}=0jˆ​×jˆ​=0
  • kˆ×kˆ=0\^{k}\times\^{k}=0kˆ×kˆ=0

Right Hand Rule

Definition

Finds the direction of the cross product

Example

Find the direction of a⃗×b⃗\vec{a} \times \vec{b}a×b

Using your right-hand:

  1. point your index finger along a⃗\vec{a}a
  2. point your middle finger along vector a⃗\vec{a}a
  3. a⃗×b⃗\vec{a} \times \vec{b}a×b will be in the direction of your thumb.

note-this-site-is-no-longer-being-update.text: Note: This site is no longer being updated

noteIndex.body:
## Adam's Knowledge Base

![Picture of me](/assets/images/adam.jpg){max-width: 150px, display: block, margin: 0}

## About Me

I am an undergraduate at **The** Ohio State University studying Computer Science & Engineering. I love cutting edge technology, especially when used it's for Automation, Startups, and Data Analytics.

Some other hobbies of mine include competing on the [OSU Club Wrestling Team](https://ncwa.net/teams/osu), coordinating events for the [Big Data Analytical Association](https://bdaaosu.org/), and whatever [[I'm currently working on|what-im-doing]]. I'm always looking for cool stuff to work on so please reach out if you're making of learning something interesting.

## What This Site Is

One big issue I have is that I tend to find a lot of great resources for learning a topic, but lose the, due to disorganization. To combat this pesky issue, I created this site as sort of a second brain to store things of interest. This site contains everything from my class notes to vim guides. If you would like anything added, feel free to send me an email.

## Links

- **[Github](https://github.com/aglucky)**
- **[Resume](/assets/gluck_resume.pdf)**
- **[LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/adam-gluck-111a2a174/)**
- **Email: Adam.gluck10@gmail.com**

## Note: This site is no longer being updated
